instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight short
threads.message: Hello sorry if this question has already been posted I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> it has the daughter board to the LCD when connected only to the small LCD flex farthest away from the main connector I get half back light ie gaps between lights on the screen, If I power down and connect the one closest to the main connector from the main board it kills all back light or stops the laptop turning on at all the flex has wear and tear damage ie a crack in the cable this is my first encounter with this model has anyone either repaired this cable or replaced it or are they integrated to the point it will need a full screen replacement? any help would be appreciated KJS

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2016 Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight short
threads.message: I thought it is a pretty obvious separate cable. Not replaced it yet, but pretty sure it is no issue.
